00057 #define MIN_VAL 1e-100
00058 #define MAX_VAL 1e+100
00059 
00060 template < class T > inline T sqr( T x ) { return x * x; }
00061 
00066 RBFN::RBFN( unsigned nInputs,
00067             unsigned nOutputs,
00068             unsigned nCenters )
00069   : MixtureOfGaussians( nCenters, nInputs ),
00070     A         ( nOutputs, nCenters ),
00071     b         ( nOutputs           )
00072 {
00073     unsigned i;
00074 
00075     for( i = A.nelem( ); i--; A.elem( i ) = uni( ) );
00076     for( i = b.nelem( ); i--; b.elem( i ) = uni( ) );
00077 }

00080 
00081 void RBFN::setParams( const Array< double >& w )
00082 {
00083     SIZE_CHECK( w.nelem( ) == b.nelem( ) +
00084                               A.nelem( ) +
00085                               m.nelem( ) +
00086                               v.nelem( ) )
00087 
00088     unsigned i, k;
00089 
00090     for( k = i = 0; i < b.nelem( ); ++i, ++k )
00091         {
00092         b.elem( i ) = w( k );
00093         }
00094     for( i = 0; i < A.nelem( ); ++i, ++k )
00095         {
00096         A.elem( i ) = w( k );
00097         }
00098     for( i = 0; i < m.nelem( ); ++i, ++k )
00099         {
00100         m.elem( i ) = w( k );
00101         }
00102     for( i = 0; i < v.nelem( ); ++i, ++k )
00103         {
00104         v.elem( i ) = std::max( sqr( w( k ) ), MIN_VAL );
00105         }
00106 }
00107 
00108 void RBFN::getParams( Array< double >& w ) const
00109 {
00110     unsigned i, k;
00111 
00112     w.resize( b.nelem( ) +
00113               A.nelem( ) +
00114               m.nelem( ) +
00115               v.nelem( ) );
00116 
00117     for( k = i = 0; i < b.nelem( ); ++i, ++k )
00118         {
00119         w( k ) = b.elem( i );
00120         }
00121     for( i = 0; i < A.nelem( ); ++i, ++k )
00122         {
00123         w( k ) = A.elem( i );
00124         }
00125     for( i = 0; i < m.nelem( ); ++i, ++k )
00126         {
00127         w( k ) = m.elem( i );
00128         }
00129     for( i = 0; i < v.nelem( ); ++i, ++k )
00130         {
00131         w( k ) = sqrt( std::max( v.elem( i ), MIN_VAL ) );
00132         }
00133 }

00136 
00137 void RBFN::firstLayer( const Array< double >& x, Array< double >& ex ) const
00138 {
00139     SIZE_CHECK( x.ndim( ) == 1 && x.dim( 0 ) == dim( ) )
00140 
00141     unsigned i, j;
00142     double   marg;
00143 
00144     ex.resize( size( ) );
00145 
00146     for( i = 0; i < size( ); i++ )
00147         {
00148         for( marg = 0, j = dim( ); j--; )
00149                 {
00150             marg -= sqr( x( j ) - m( i, j ) ) / std::max( v( i, j ), MIN_VAL );
00151                 }
00152         ex( i ) = exp( marg / 2 );
00153     }
00154 }

00157 
00158 double RBFN::gradientMSE( const Array< double >& in,
00159                           const Array< double >& out,
00160                           Array< double >& de )
00161 {
00162   
00163     unsigned i, j, k, l;
00164     double s, t, db, mse;
00165     Array< double > e;
00166     Array< double > d( size( ) );
00167 
00168     mse = 0.;
00169 
00170     de.resize( b.nelem( ) +
00171                A.nelem( ) +
00172                m.nelem( ) +
00173                v.nelem( ) );
00174 
00175     if( in.ndim( ) == 2 )
00176         {
00177         de = 0.;
00178 
00179         for( l = 0; l < in.dim( 0 ); ++l )
00180                 {
00181             firstLayer( in[ l ], e );
00182 
00183             d = 0.;
00184 
00185             for( j = 0; j < odim( ); ++j )
00186                         {
00187                 db = b( j ) - out( l, j );
00188                 for( k = 0; k < size( ); ++k )
00189                                 {
00190                     db += A( j, k ) * e( k );
00191                                 }
00192                 mse += db * db;
00193                 de( j ) += ( db *= 2 );
00194 
00195                 for( i = j * size( ) + b.nelem( ), k = 0; k < size( );
00196                      ++k, ++i )
00197                                 {
00198                     de( i ) += db * e( k );
00199                     d ( k ) += db * e( k ) * A( j, k );
00200                 }
00201             }
00202 
00203             for( j = b.nelem( ) + A.nelem( ), k = 0; k < size( ); ++k )
00204                         {
00205                 for( i = 0; i < dim( ); ++i, ++j )
00206                                 {
00207                     s = sqrt( std::max( v( k, i ), MIN_VAL ) );
00208                     t = in( l, i ) - m( k, i );
00209 
00210                     de( j              ) += d( k ) * t  / ( s*s   );
00211                     de( j + m.nelem( ) ) += d( k ) * t*t/ ( s*s*s );
00212                 }
00213                         }
00214         }
00215         
00216 
00217         de /= (double) in.dim( 0 ); // added by M. Huesken, 19.10.2001
00218 
00219         return mse / in.dim( 0 );
00220     }
00221         else
00222         {
00223         firstLayer( in, e );
00224 
00225         d = 0.;
00226 
00227         for( j = 0; j < odim( ); ++j )
00228                 {
00229             db = b( j ) - out( j );
00230             for( k = 0; k < size( ); ++k )
00231                         {
00232                 db += A( j, k ) * e( k );
00233                         }
00234             de( j ) = ( db *= 2 );
00235             mse += db * db;
00236 
00237             for( i = j * size( ) + b.nelem( ), k = 0; k < size( ); ++k, ++i )
00238                         {
00239                 d( k ) += ( de( i ) = db * e( k ) ) * A( j, k );
00240                         }
00241         }
00242 
00243         for( j = b.nelem( ) + A.nelem( ), k = 0; k < size( ); ++k )
00244                 {
00245             for( i = 0; i < dim( ); ++i, ++j )
00246                         {
00247                 s = sqrt( std::max( v( k, i ), MIN_VAL ) );
00248                 t = in( i ) - m( k, i );
00249 
00250                 de( j + m.nelem( ) ) = ( de( j ) = d( k ) * t/s*s ) * t/s;
00251             }
00252                 }
00253 
00254         return mse;
00255     }
00256 }

00259 
00260 void RBFN::gradientOut( const Array< double >& in, Array< double >& dw )
00261 {
00262     unsigned dwi, i, j, k, o;
00263     double s, t, Ae;
00264     Array< double > e;
00265 
00266     dw.resize( odim( ),
00267                b.nelem( ) +
00268                A.nelem( ) +
00269                m.nelem( ) +
00270                v.nelem( ) );
00271 
00272     firstLayer( in, e );
00273 
00274     for( o = 0; o < odim( ); ++o )
00275         {
00276         for( dwi = j = 0; j < odim( ); ++j, ++dwi )
00277                 {
00278             dw( o, dwi ) = o == j ? 1. : 0.;
00279                 }
00280 
00281         for( j = 0; j < odim( ); ++j )
00282                 {
00283             for( k = 0; k < size( ); ++k, ++dwi )
00284                         {
00285                 dw( o, dwi ) = o == j ? e( k ) : 0.;
00286                         }
00287                 }
00288 
00289         for( k = 0; k < size( ); ++k )
00290                 {
00291             Ae = A( o, k ) * e( k );
00292 
00293             for( i = 0; i < dim( ); ++i, ++dwi )
00294                         {
00295                 s  = sqrt( v( k, i ) );
00296                 t  = in( i ) - m( k, i );
00297 
00298                 dw( o, dwi ) = Ae * t / std::max( s*s, MIN_VAL );
00299                 dw( o, dwi + m.nelem( ) ) = Ae * t * t / std::max( s*s*s, MIN_VAL );
00300             }
00301         }
00302     }
00303 }

00306 
00307 void RBFN::estimateFisherInformation( const Array< double >& input,
00308                                       const Array< double >& output,
00309                                       Array< double >& A )
00310 {
00311     SIZE_CHECK( input.ndim( ) == 2 )
00312 
00313     unsigned i;
00314     Array< double > dw;
00315 
00316     for( i = 0; i < input.dim( 0 ); ++i )
00317         {
00318         gradientOut( input[ i ], dw );
00319         dw.resize( dw.nelem( ), true );
00320         if( i == 0 )
00321                 {
00322             A = outerProduct( dw, dw );
00323                 }
00324         else
00325                 {
00326             A += outerProduct( dw, dw );
00327                 }
00328     }
00329 
00330     A /= mse( input, output );
00331 }
00332 
00333 //===========================================================================
00334 
00335 void RBFN::estimateInvFisher
00336 (
00337     const Array< double >& input,
00338     const Array< double >& output,
00339     Array< double >& invA,
00340     Array< double >& transInvA,
00341     double &S2
00342 )
00343 {
00344     SIZE_CHECK( input.ndim( ) == 2 )
00345 
00346     unsigned i;
00347     Array< double > A;
00348     Array< double > dw;
00349     Array< double > dwMean;
00350 
00351     for( i = 0; i < input.dim( 0 ); ++i )
00352     {
00353         gradientOut( input[ i ], dw );
00354         dw.resize( dw.nelem( ), true );
00355         if( i == 0 )
00356         {
00357                         A = outerProduct( dw, dw );
00358             dwMean = dw;
00359         }
00360         else
00361         {
00362             A += outerProduct( dw, dw );
00363             dwMean += dw;
00364         }
00365     }
00366 
00367     S2 = mse( input, output );
00368     A /= S2;
00369 
00370     invA = invert( A );
00371 
00372     //
00373     // inner_product yields the same results as matrix_product (not
00374     // implemented yet) since all matrices are symmetric
00375     //
00376     transInvA = innerProduct( invA,
00377                     innerProduct( outerProduct( dwMean, dwMean ), invA ) );
00378 }

00380 //===========================================================================
00381 
00382 double RBFN::overallVariance( const Array< double >& input,
00383                               const Array< double >& output )
00384 {
00385     SIZE_CHECK( input.ndim( ) == 2 )
00386 
00387     unsigned i;
00388     Array< double > A;
00389     Array< double > invA;
00390     Array< double > invAdwMean;
00391     Array< double > dw;
00392     Array< double > dwMean;
00393 
00394     for( i = 0; i < input.dim( 0 ); ++i )
00395         {
00396         gradientOut( input[ i ], dw );
00397         dw.resize( dw.nelem( ), true );
00398         if( i == 0 )
00399                 {
00400             A = outerProduct( dw, dw );
00401             dwMean = dw;
00402         }
00403                 else
00404                 {
00405             A += outerProduct( dw, dw );
00406             dwMean += dw;
00407         }
00408     }
00409 
00410     A /= mse( input, output );
00411     invA = invert( A );
00412     invAdwMean = innerProduct( invA, outerProduct( dwMean, dwMean ) );
00413 
00414     return scalarProduct( dwMean, innerProduct( invA, dwMean ) )
00415          + trace( invAdwMean );
00416 }

00418 //===========================================================================
00419 
00420 double RBFN::estimateVariance( const Array< double >& input,
00421                                const Array< double >& invA )
00422 {
00423     Array< double > dw;
00424     gradientOut( input, dw );
00425     dw.resize( dw.nelem( ), true );
00426     return scalarProduct( dw, innerProduct( invA, dw ) );
00427 }
00428 
00429 //===========================================================================
00430 
00431 //
00432 // cf. David A. Cohn: Neural Network Exploration Using Optimal Experimental
00433 //     Design. A.I. Memo No. 1491 (via ftp://publications.ai.mit.edu)
00434 //
00435 double RBFN::estimateVarianceChange( const Array< double >& input,
00436                                      const Array< double >& invA,
00437                                      const Array< double >& transInvA,
00438                                      double S2 )
00439 {
00440     Array< double > dw;
00441     gradientOut( input, dw );
00442     dw.resize( dw.nelem( ), true );
00443     return scalarProduct( dw, innerProduct( transInvA, dw ) )
00444       / ( S2 + scalarProduct( dw, innerProduct( invA, dw ) ) );
00445 }

00448 
00449 void RBFN::initialize( const Array< double >& x, const Array< double >& y )
00450 {
00451     //
00452     // initialize centers and widths of Gaussians
00453     //
00454     MixtureOfGaussians::initialize( x );
00455     MixtureOfGaussians::kmc( x );
00456 
00457     //
00458     // train linear weights with least squares method
00459     //
00460     A.resize( A.dim( 0 ), MixtureOfGaussians::dim( ) );
00461     train_linear( x, y );
00462 }
00463 
00464 //===========================================================================
00465 
00466 void RBFN::initialize_linear( double min, double max )
00467 {
00468     unsigned i;
00469 
00470     for( i = b.nelem( ); i--; )
00471         {
00472         b.elem( i ) = uni( min, max );
00473         }
00474     for( i = A.nelem( ); i--; )
00475         {
00476         A.elem( i ) = uni( min, max );
00477         }
00478 }
00479 
00480 //===========================================================================
00481 
00482 void RBFN::train_linear( const Array< double >& x,
00483                          const Array< double >& y )
00484 {
00485     SIZE_CHECK( x.ndim( ) <= 2 )
00486 
00487     Array< double > e;
00488     LinearRegression lr;
00489 
00490     if( x.ndim( ) == 2 )
00491         {
00492         for( unsigned i = 0; i < x.dim( 0 ); ++i )
00493                 {
00494             firstLayer( x[ i ], e );
00495             lr.train( e, y[ i ] );
00496         }
00497     }
00498         else
00499         {
00500         firstLayer( x, e );
00501         lr.train( e, y );
00502     }
00503 
00504     A = lr.A( );
00505     b = lr.b( );
00506 }

00509 
00510 void RBFN::insertRBFData( const Array< double >& input,
00511                           const Array< double >& output,
00512                           const Array< double >& minInput,
00513                           const Array< double >& maxInput )
00514 {
00515     unsigned i, j;
00516     Array< double > newA( output.dim( 1 ) );
00517     Array< double > newm( input .dim( 1 ) );
00518     Array< double > newv( input .dim( 1 ) );
00519 
00520     //
00521     // if either minimum or maximum is not specified then compute it with
00522     // help of the given data
00523     //
00524     if( minInput.nelem( ) == 0 || maxInput.nelem( ) == 0 )
00525         {
00526         Array< double > minIn, maxIn;
00527         minIn = maxIn = input[ 0 ];
00528         for( i = 0; i < input.dim( 0 ); ++i )
00529                 {
00530             for( j = 0; j < input.dim( 0 ); ++j )
00531                         {
00532                 if( input( i, j ) < minIn( j ) ) minIn( j ) = input( i, j );
00533                 if( input( i, j ) > maxIn( j ) ) maxIn( j ) = input( i, j );
00534             }
00535                 }
00536         //
00537         // sample a random mean vector
00538         //
00539         for( j = 0; j < newm.nelem( ); ++j )
00540                 {
00541             newm( j ) = Rng::uni( minIn( j ), maxIn( j ) );
00542                 }
00543     }
00544         else
00545         {
00546         //
00547         // sample a random mean vector
00548         //
00549         for( j = 0; j < newm.nelem( ); ++j )
00550                 {
00551             newm( j ) = Rng::uni( minInput( j ), maxInput( j ) );
00552                 }
00553     }
00554 
00555     if( size( ) )
00556         {
00557         //
00558         // find the distance to the nearest neighbor
00559         //
00560         double d, dist = ::sqrDistance( m[ 0 ], newm );
00561         for( i = 1; i < size( ); ++i )
00562                 {
00563             d = ::sqrDistance( m[ i ], newm );
00564             if( d < dist )
00565                         {
00566                                 dist = d;
00567                         }
00568         }
00569 
00570         //
00571         // set the variance randomly scattered around the minimum distance
00572         //
00573         for( j = 0; j < dim( ); ++j )
00574                 {
00575             newv( j ) = uni( dist * 0.9, dist * 1.1 );
00576                 }
00577 
00578         //
00579         // set the linear weight
00580         //
00581         RBFN tmp( dim( ), 1, 1 );
00582         double sum;
00583         Array< double > oldout, newout;
00584         newA = 1;
00585         tmp.insertRBF( newA, newm, newv );
00586         sum  = 0;
00587         newA = 0;
00588         for( j = 0; j < input.dim( 0 ); ++j )
00589                 {
00590             recall( input[ j ], oldout );
00591                 tmp.recall( input[ j ], newout );
00592                     newA += ( output[ j ] - oldout ) * newout( 0 );
00593                         sum  += sqr( newout( 0 ) );
00594                 }
00595         newA /= sum;
00596     }
00597         else
00598         {
00599         //
00600         // do something (sensible?)
00601         //
00602         newA = 1;
00603         newv = 1;
00604     }
00605 
00606     insertRBF( newA, newm, newv );
00607 }
00608 
00609 //===========================================================================
00610 
00611 void RBFN::insertRBF( const Array< double >& newA,
00612                       const Array< double >& newm,
00613                       const Array< double >& newv )
00614 {
00615     unsigned i, j;
00616     Array< double > oldA( A );
00617 
00618     A.resize( odim( ), size( ) + 1 );
00619 
00620     for( i = 0; i < odim( ); ++i )
00621         {
00622         for( j = 0; j < size( ); ++j )
00623                 {
00624             A( i, j ) = oldA( i, j );
00625                 }
00626         }
00627 
00628     for( i = 0; i < odim( ); ++i )
00629         {
00630         A( i, size( ) ) = newA( i );
00631         }
00632 
00633     insertKernel( 1, newm, newv );
00634 }
00635 
00636 void RBFN::deleteRBF( unsigned k )
00637 {
00638     RANGE_CHECK( k < size( ) )
00639 
00640     unsigned i, j;
00641     Array< double > oldA( A );
00642 
00643     A.resize( odim( ), size( ) - 1 );
00644 
00645     for( i = 0; i < odim( ); ++i )
00646         {
00647         for( j = 0; j < k; ++j )
00648                 {
00649             A( i, j ) = oldA( i, j );
00650                 }
00651         for( j = k + 1; j < size( ); ++j )
00652                 {
00653             A( i, j - 1 ) = oldA( i, j );
00654                 }
00655     }
00656 
00657     deleteKernel( k );
00658 }

00666     MixtureOfGaussians::resize( num, ninput );

00669 void RBFN::resize( unsigned num, bool copy )
00670 {
00671     resize( dim( ), odim( ), num, copy );

00686     else {
00687         Array< double > var( dim( ) );
00688         if( size( ) == 0 ) {
00689             var = std::max( delta, MIN_VAL );
00690             insertRBF( y, x, var );
00691             b = 0;
00692         } else {
00693             double d;
00694             err = 0;
00695             gradient( x, y );
00696             if( err > epsilon &&
00697                 ( d = euclidian_distance( x, m[ nearest( x ) ] ) ) > delta ) {
00698                 dm = 0;
00699                 ds = 0;
00700                 dA = 0;
00701                 dB = 0;
00702 
00703                 Array< double > yy;
00704                 recall( x, yy );
00705                 var = std::max( d, MIN_VAL );
00706                 insertRBF( y - yy, x, var );
00707             } else
00708                 update( );
00709         }
00710     }
00711 }

00714 //===========================================================================
00715 
00716 void RBFN::recall( const Array< double >& x, Array< double >& y ) const
00717 { 
00718     SIZE_CHECK( x.ndim( ) <= 2 )
00719 
00720     Array< double > e;
00721 
00722     if( x.ndim( ) == 2 )
00723         {
00724         y.resize( x.dim( 0 ), b.dim( 0 ) );
00725         for( unsigned i = 0; i < x.dim( 0 ); ++i )
00726                 {
00727             firstLayer( x[ i ], e );
00728             y[ i ] = innerProduct( A, e ) + b;
00729         }
00730     }
00731         else
00732         {
00733         firstLayer( x, e );
00734         y = innerProduct( A, e ) + b;
00735     }
00736 }

00739 
00740 double RBFN::curvature( )
00741 {
00742     double curve = 0;
00743 
00744     for( unsigned j = 0; j < odim( ); ++j )
00745     {
00746         for( unsigned i = 0; i < size( ); ++i )
00747         {
00748                         a( i ) = A( j, i );
00749         }
00750         curve += MixtureOfGaussians::curvature( );
00751     }
00752 
00753     return curve;
00754 }
00755 
00756 void RBFN::gradientCurve( Array< double >& de )
00757 {
00758     unsigned i, j, k;
00759     Array< double > da, dm, ds;
00760 
00761     de.resize( b.nelem( ) +
00762                A.nelem( ) +
00763                m.nelem( ) +
00764                v.nelem( ) );
00765     de = 0.;
00766 
00767     for( j = 0; j < odim( ); ++j )
00768         {
00769         for( i = 0; i < size( ); ++i )
00770                 {
00771             a( i ) = A( j, i );
00772                 }
00773         MixtureOfGaussians::dCurveams( da, dm, ds );
00774 
00775         for( k = b.nelem( ) + j * size( ), i = 0; i < da.nelem( ); ++i, ++k )
00776                 {
00777             de( k ) += da( i );
00778                 }
00779 
00780         for( k = b.nelem( ) + A.nelem( ), i = 0; i < dm.nelem( ); ++i, ++k )
00781                 {
00782             de( k ) += dm( i );
00783                 }
00784 
00785         for( i = 0; i < ds.nelem( ); ++i, ++k )
00786                 {
00787             de( k ) += ds( i );
00788                 }
00789     }
00790 }
